website_summaries.verdict: With an ergonomically designed handlebar and satisfying power, we think you'll love using this brush cutter for heavy-duty jobs.
pros: Awesome torque and even power distribution
Can be used with trimmer head or grass blade
cons: It's pricey, and some say it's difficult to put together

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months of heavy use, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: While I believe this is the "smallest" clearing saw Husquvarna offers, it is very adequate for my needs. I have ~20 acres of field and wooded property in the mountains of East TN and am constantly battling mimosa and sweetgum trees. The 336FR takes down 3-4 inch diameter mimosa's like a "hot knife through butter". So far, no issue with the equipment. Easy start, the harness makes it relatively easy to handle (and I am normally on hilly, uneven ground) and excellent fuel consumption. The brush cutting blade devastates taller grass and up to 2" saplings. The string trimmer, well, it blows away any other string trimmer I have used. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bonno

customer_reviews.title: I would like the pole to be just a little longer
customer_reviews.text: I would like the pole to be just a little longer, but man... this thing works. I recommend either buying a better blade to go with this if you are cutting a lot of brush or be prepared to sharpen the one included a lot. The blade that came with mine was sharp out of the package but dulled noticeable after the first time running it (one tank of gas and a lot of brush to it's credit). Overall I am happy with the product and will be using it to clear about 2.5 acres of underbrush from my wooded property.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: most convenient thing ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have borrowed one of these to cut down cedar trees in pastures and really thought it was great, so bought one of my own to cut out volunteer shrub/trees etc out of CRP pasture ground. With the saw blade it is very good for up to 3 inch trunk and a little thicker ones require a little extra time and you have to cut from the other side also. The harness is very sturdy and makes toting it around surprisingly comfortable. Haven't used it for any trimming so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Misterjag

customer_reviews.title: Great for brush clearing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in clearing land annually. This is my first year to use it and so far it has been great. Starts up on 2nd pull typically. Ran for about 5 hours without issues and doesn't suck through the gas like some others I've had. Hoping to get some good years out of this. Lots of power and was able to cut just about any width of tree desired, including some little pine trees in the front of the house that were about 7".
customer_reviews.author: tengleha

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna worth the money??
customer_reviews.text: Update as of 10/20/18 The cutter was fixed under warranty. So far so good and it cuts very well. I would have given it 5 starts but it broke down... It ran about an hour in all before stalling and would not start again. Tried a new plug with nothing changing. So now I have to go to a Husqvarna dealer to get it looked at. In Maine that’s a 45 min ride one way. Follow up. Dealer told me it’s a bad ignition coil. 5 to 7 days to get parts. My brush hog and chainsaw are getting a workout doing what I bought this saw for.
customer_reviews.author: A 2 Z

customer_reviews.title: Big, heavy, sturdy, TOUGH. Very strong machine.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong engine, a welcome relief from lightweight household brush cutters. Large fuel tank, easy to use choke. The handlebar grip is adjustable to the user's preference, and the included harness is strong and comfortable. I use this in a rural setting, for clearing rather heavy brush and sticker-vines. This unit is very POWERFUL to the cheaper models. It's strong enough that the head won't seize up when tangles with vines or long grass!
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Halsan

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, warranty will not be honored
customer_reviews.text: Was a decent brush cutter when it worked, but Husqvarna's quality has taken a dip and they don't stand by their products. Used a few times for medium brush cutting clearing a damn, then the motor quit. Repair shop said it looked like the motor had been run without the proper oil mixture and scored the cylinder bore. Only fuel that had ever been run was Husqvarna pre-mixed fuel, Husqvarna denied any warranty repair. Called their escalation department, what a joke, they said it was a fuel issue. I said it was their fuel, they replied that they don't warranty the fuel just the machine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: The Brush Cutter arrived well packaged and was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The Brush Cutter arrived well packaged and was easy to assemble. I have been using the Husqvarna 336FR around the farm with the grass blade attached and have found that it is very effective in cleaning off the fence. The unit destroys briar vines but does have a tendency to shoot debris back at your face. Safety equipment is a must both glasses and hearing protection is recommended. The cutter head spins up quickly and the response from the motor is fast. The harness enclosed with the cutter is a real shoulder saver by distributing the weight which makes working longer easier. I am enjoying the Husqvarna 336FR Brush Cutter and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: The J.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I can clear an acre in a day.
customer_reviews.text: The stock blade (I've tried three different ones) is phenomenal. Clears everything from grass to 1" softwood in a barely slowed golf swing. Quick to resharpen with an ordinary hand file. Harness is well balanced, needed because it is a heavier tool.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Roisum, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Machine!  Like having a portable bushhog!
customer_reviews.text: Truly a beast! You haven't worked until you've run a tank full of gas through a Husqvarna brushcutter! This thing eats whatever you throw at, like your own portable bushhog with the ability to switch blades and saw trees off flush with the ground.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Crazy powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts through underbrush like butter! Instructions were terrible but plenty of online guides. Easy to start and easy to use. The included harness works great and really like that it came with 3 different head attachments
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy duty jobs
customer_reviews.text: Primarily using the three-blade cutter on quite high weeds and young invasive bamboo stalks. Works like a champ. The unit is quite large and much heavier than ordinary weed eaters, takes some getting used to— especially strapping the harness on.
customer_reviews.author: eJohn123

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Handles well and cuts like a beast! And 3 great attachments that will handle anything on your property.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Part missing in delivered package
customer_reviews.text: The Husqvarna 336FR was delivered missing the plastic cover over the handlebar attachment.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a broken box, it appeared to be just the box that was broken but after set up and running for 15 minutes the engine seized up. I am waiting on approval to have it returned and will update this feed upon contact from SELLER.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ENGINE SEIZED
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easy to start After about one minute Engine Seized This is the worse Husqvarna weed eater I have ever owned and for the price should have worked without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Strazay

customer_reviews.title: Weed eater on steroids
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for some who has a lot of of weed eating and brush. I have not use the saw blade yet. Thi
customer_reviews.author: Big brother watches

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: It took a month for this brush cutter to arrive. It is missing parts for assembly and a saw blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Balanced nicely with the harness
customer_reviews.text: Have property with many trails and I took it up this past weekend to widen them a little. Worked great. Balanced nicely with the harness. Had the clearing blade attached and it made quick work of what used to be done by hand with a pruner.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Problems from the start
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were poorly written and incomplete. Was hard starting and stalled numerous times when cold. Had to adjust carb. Runs and performs well once it gets going. Shouldn’t have any of these issues with a brand new $600 tool
customer_reviews.author: Charles J.  Ricci

customer_reviews.title: It worked even better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Cut 2" saplings like going through butter with a knife. I am highly satisfied with the brush cutter and the tree blade that came with it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: donald l rexrode

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but few instructions to put it together
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is threat but there were very few instructions on putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: N. OldElk

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Could use a storage bag for all the blades and stuff though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Do not count on two day shipping, contains hazardous material and is more like 7-10...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered item on the 2nd with 2 day shipping it is not expected to arrive until the 14th...
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Anyone who does not like this brush cutter should stay in the house
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who does not like this brush cutter should stay in the house. I had one of these in the 80s, so this is my second one. I have used it for the last two weeks and it is great. I have used all three of the heads that came with it. It starts easy and is good quality. You could get a heavier duty one but I don't think there is a need. You can use a chain saw on larger trees. The price is right I believe, so good luck.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this brush-cutter
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this brush-cutter. It is lightweight, easy to use and powerful. This machine gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: gloria

customer_reviews.title: Thought this would be a quality machine. But after ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a quality machine. But after using it for less than 3hrs the motor ceased. And Proton what let me return it cause I based it up and used it. Do not buy this product here go threw local dealer! And now I have to wait and hear what husqvarna will do about it. I needed this to get projects done. Filled it with the right gas and did everything right. What junk! Also ordered the helmet with ear muffs and face shield and got it with no face shield.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Scanlan

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well
customer_reviews.text: The guard gets in the way though the chainsaw tooth blade works well. The handlebar connection to the shaft is weak but has held up for 12 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Not Happy

customer_reviews.title: USE ONLY THE CORRECT OIL TO GAS RATIO
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great for three years and I loved it. This weekend, I didn't have a can of premixed ethanol free and oil, so I poured in ethanol free gasoline and "some" Stihl oil without measuring. Huge mistake on my part. The engine overheated and seized. I took it to the dealer where I purchased it, and they said it would be $500 to fix it or $599 for a new one. I was used to older equipment, I guess, where the ratio of oil to gas didn't have to be as exact.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Poage

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but hard to start after running
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine when it starts. Plenty of power, well balanced and works well with the saw blade. It's a bit clunky for changing attachments which could be a lot better. Harness is okay but Sthil harness is better. The real problem is that it starts fine when cold but once hot, the idle is not set properly or something but have to hold the throttle open a bit to it started.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Gordon

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 336FR 966604702 Bike Handle Pro Brushcutter with Line/Brush and Saw Blade, 34.6 cc
product_meta.description: Husqvarna 336fr bike handle pro Brush cutter 34.6cc With line, brush and saw blade 966604702. Husqvarna 336fr comes complete with trimmer head, grass blade and saw blade. This flexibility makes it an ideal solution for people who require the benefits both products offer in one, effective package. The X-Torq engine provide raw power and excellent fuel economy. Delivered with balance 35 harness. Ergonomic harness that distribute the load optimally between your shoulders, chest and back. Bevel gear designed with high torque and the cutting equipment parallel to the ground for best cutting performance. Adjustable and ergonomically designed handlebar for best comfort. The X-Torq engine design reduces harmful exhaust emissions by up to 60% and increases fuel efficiency by up to 20%. Removes air from carburetor and fuel system for easy starting. When the machine is turned off, the stop switch automatically returns to the start position for easier starting. The cutting attachment guard can be used with either a grass blade or a trimmer head. Twin line cutting system with tap 'n go for quick line feed.
feature_bullets: The X-Torq engine provide raw power and excellent fuel economy
Adjustable and ergonomically designed handlebar for best comfort
The X-Torq engine design reduces harmful exhaust emissions
34.6Cc With line, brush and saw blade

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars57 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
